name: Manmeet Singh Hayer
tagline: Finance & Computer Science Student | Data Analytics & Automation | Investment Banking & AI Enthusiast
bio: I'm a finance analyst who codes. I use Python/VBA/SQL, Microsoft Office, BI and ERP tools to turn messy operational data into decisions—budget vs. actuals, variance patterns, unit economics—and build small automations that save real hours. I like ownership, tight feedback loops, and shipping useful tools fast. Senior at DePauw (Finance & CS), graduating May 2026; open to roles in corporate finance/FP&A, investment analysis & portfolio management, BNPL/fintech, and data-heavy product or analytics work.

projects.title: GE Vernova (NYSE: GEV) — Equity Investment Research Report
projects.description: Developed a full, analyst-grade equity investment research report on GE Vernova, replicating the structure and rigor of professional buy-side and sell-side research. The project was completed as part of FIN 365: Portfolio Management and focused on evaluating GE Vernova's long-term fundamentals, intrinsic value, and suitability for inclusion in an institutional portfolio such as the DePauw student endowment fund.
achievements: Conducted business and industry analysis across GE Vernova's Power, Wind, and Electrification segments, with emphasis on backlog visibility, margin recovery, and secular demand drivers such as grid modernization and electrification.
Analyzed historical performance, focusing on post-2022 financials following the company's spin-off to establish a realistic baseline for forward projections.
Built segment-level revenue and margin forecasts aligned with management guidance and Bloomberg consensus, stress-tested across multiple market and execution scenarios.
Constructed a 7-year FCFF DCF model using two terminal value methodologies, alongside a Sum-of-the-Parts (SOTP) valuation to reflect differing growth and profitability profiles across segments.
Complemented intrinsic valuation with relative valuation analysis using EV/EBITDA and P/E multiples to benchmark GE Vernova against relevant peers.
Delivered a defensible BUY recommendation, supported by intrinsic value, improving profitability, and long-duration infrastructure demand rather than multiple expansion alone.
